alert.note: Alert for Bradley; Drew (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 9:28PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Bradley and southwestern Drew Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 928 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hermitage, or 13 miles southwest of Warren, moving east at 20 mph. This storm has a history of producing rainfall rates in excess of two inches per hour. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Monticello... Warren... Hermitage... Wilmar... Green Hill... Ingalls... Hilo... Lanark... Ladelle... Prairie Grove... New Hope in Drew County... Carmel... Farmville... Johnsonville... Vick... Valley... Gravelridge... Mt Olive in Bradley County... Marsden... Jersey... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southeastern and southwestern Arkansas.
